intro: Moquiniastrum oligocephalum, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that produce wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, often forming dense stands in marshes and pond edges. Moquiniastrum oligocephalum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
